attributes.action: Parliament recognise the public own the NHS not any party
attributes.additional_details:
The USA system bankrupts services users who are from low to middle income groups who are unfortunate enough to become ill.

The American system is writing off the needs of the many. The spectre of a two tier service that provides a service for the few and a second rate uncaring underfunded service for the rest.
Credit card readers in ambulances? Financial checks as you book into A&E? The massive proliferation of debt collecting agencies and insolvency practitioners?
attributes.background:
41years 19 days ago I joined the NHS starting as a student ending as a Matron for 23 years

Our “leader” is clearly intent on the radical reform of OUR service into some sort of clone of the failed system in the USA famed for its ability to enrich service providers.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
